comment: She does not accept late work even if it is 1 minute late she will still give you a 0. She doesn't grade until midterm and final. She watches lockdown browser test and will report you to SCAI if you miss one guideline. So show your ID, scan the room, and don't even look away from your test or close your eyes for 1 second! 0/10 don't recommend.

she grades VERY harshly. Weekly audio discussion posts. She watches EVERY exam if you look away for two seconds she will comment on it. There's no extra credit and professor isn't very understanding when it comes to extensions of any kind. Doesn't really set u up for success imo.tests are hard and the test reviews are not informative whatsoever…

Would not take her again. Tests were abnormally hard. She grades everything way too hard, like taking points off for things that other professors don't care about. The class was interesting and I like the setup, but I would try to take a different professor if you can. Her tests are really hard to do well because she loves trick questions.

I cannot recommend her enough! She is so passionate about everything she teaches and really tries to make the course work fun to learn. The tests were pretty difficult, but the every-day course work was easy. Just make sure to study. Almost every week had a verbal discussion assignment, which was new for me but they were honestly really fun.

This is the best course. Dr. Marsil is so interesting and is really passionate about forensic. She is dedicated to helping you succeed. You do need to read and listen to lectures. VoiceThreads were time consuming but really helpful to my presentation skills. Tests are not easy but if you study its not crazy hard.

Professor Marsil is not worth 4 stars, much alone 1. Her lecture, test, and discussion-heavy course is graded harshly. She will watch the lockdown browser exam. I'm still in her class and can see this won't end well. Do not take this class if you want to graduate.

This was very interesting class and she was a great professor. Clear grading on all of the assignments. Test are not bad if you study for them and read the textbook a lot of the material is from there. Overall, I would recommend taking this class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Marsil is one of the best professors I have ever had. While this class can be difficult at times, she does everything she can to set her students up for success. She is a kind and caring professor who gives great lectures and genuinely cares about her students. As long as you do your part, you should thrive in this class. TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!

Overall a pretty good class. I took it as a 4 week summer class, and boy was it a lot of work. However, I took it along with 3 other classes. If you took it on its own or with 1 other, you'd be fine. 4 exams (plus optional final), 4 discussions and somewhat daily assignments. Easy A as all exams were open note. Definitely would take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I took this as a 4-week online summer class and she made it super easy. We had to read a chapter daily with about 4-6 online assignments (2 jeopardy game assignments, one quiz, and a 2-3 minute video) that went with the textbook. There are 4 tests, 4 discussion posts, and an optional final. There was work almost every day, but it's a summer class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Tests aren't bad if you study. Four class discussions - one per module - graded generously. Other grades come from online work that is part of the textbook program. This was SO much easier than my previous psych class.

Dr. Marsil is accessible and helps in any way possible. There are discussions, quizzes, and of course the paper. Do the work and you will pass. No book necessary. She is willing to provide any help. She is really worth taking.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: The class work in itself is not very hard, however it takes weeks to get grades back and it's almost impossible to get ahold of her. She also forgets to open assignments so it will be the day before something is due and you still won't even know what the assignment is. She makes the class unnecessarily hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This class was alright. I took a 4 week summer class so I had to read the entire textbook. The set up of the class was confusing for a while. 4 tests. 4 discussion posts. However, we did raise a virtual child which was cool. If you read the textbook you should be fine. Sometimes assignments took the entire day. This isn't a bad choice.

A lot of work to do but some are watching videos and doing the weekly module assignments including module discussion post and exams. Exams are lockdown browser with webcam, I would suggest study from the textbook. The final is open-notes and will help boost your grade. She is willing to help if you want to go to grad school.

Dr. Marsil is awesome! I'll admit taking Forensic is harder than I expected, but I loved it. She is an amazing resource for things outside of class as well. She has spent time with me helping me for grad school, and she truly wants her students to succeed. Reading the text will help you tremendously in class. Would take again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Marsil is awesome. Weekly readings, discussion posts, and quizzes. 3 tests (multiple choice and short answer), a few short essays, and 1 big paper. You have to put in the work, but her lectures and the material are really interesting and she doesn't make it overly tough. Would highly recommend.

Forensic has been one of my favorite classes I've ever taken. Dr. Marsil is passionate about the subject and keeps lectures interesting. There's a good bit of reading, quizzes and discussion posts, but very consistent and nothing too difficult. Tests are tough, but everything you need is very accessible. I definitely recommend taking this class!

This class was way harder than it should of been. She treats her class as if it's graduate school and not undergrad. Her grading was all over the place, extremely tough, and took forever. Her rubrics are very unclear and her feedback on assignments is very harsh. I would not recommend this professor at all if you need the course to graduate.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Love Dr. Marsil. I took her for forensic and it was easily the most enjoyable class I have taken at KSU. She is so passionate about the topics and really knows her stuff. Weekly discussion posts and online quizzes (hybrid), but you can use the book. Hands out extra credit points for attendance like candy if you come to class. 10/10 would recommend!

Took her for Forensic Psych hybrid. It's important to go to class to get extra points. You won't pass the online quizzes if you don't read the chapter, so the book is a must. Easy once a week discussion post and one big paper, but it's over an interesting topic so it's not hard to write at all. Her midterm & final is much harder than it should be.
Her workload is light and she grades easily.  I would take her again in a heartbeat.
Just follow the syllabus and do the assigned workk online and you will have no problem getting an A or B.  I highly recommend her.  Great professor
Easy A   TAke her.  She doesn't assign too much reading and her tests are extremely fair.  Best psychology teacher at ksu by far.

This class was Forensic Psych- hybrid. Loved the material and the in class sessions were fun.  Attendance is highly suggested-to get those extra points.  Weekly discussion questions and quizzes.  Two or three essay questions on the tests but not too in depth.  Enjoyed the lectures and material.  Book mandatory
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Forensic Psych has been my fav class so far. The class discussions were great and Dr. Marsil really challenges you to think.

For an elective class this was a joke. Forensics was supposed to be fun, and this is an undergrad class-not a graduate, yes she grades you as if you are an expert. Tests are never the material covered in class. She seems lenient and caring in class, yet any writing assignments, she is super tough and gives no credit. I would not take her ever again

I would not recommend taking this class online unless you are prepared to work really hard.  I put in more time on this class than my traditional classes.  She provides study guides, but you have to read EVERYTHING and take notes on all of the statistics in order to do well on quizzes/tests.  There is a lot of online discussion and participation.

The class was hard, but I have never had a professor who is so helpful. She really went out of her way to be helpful and meet with me when I was having a hard time. There are a lot of assignmets and a lot to keep up with, but she was great.

There's 1 week of class left. These past couple of reviews are true. I still don't have grades from the 3rd week of school. She takes forever to grade and makes smart remarks when you ask about them. It is a wonder she's still here she clearly doesn't enjoy teaching. Interrupts during presentations to express her intelligence. Find someone else....

She is the absolute worst. She makes this class more difficult than it has to be. She has no problem failing seniors for not writing a certain way. You will not get any of your grades in a timely fashion and when you do get them they will be ridiculously low. As the other comments stated her grading is not consistent. Take someone else.

Marsil's grading is not very consistent. She barely graded rough drafts, but heavily critiqued and failed students over the final draft. You will not get grades back in time for anything. She will tell you one thing to your face and your grades will say the total opposite. She is not always clear in her directions. Avoid her if you want to graduate

I will start by saying that she is sweet when she wants to be. She is not consistent with grading. It takes forever for her to grade assignments. Her directions are not always clear so you will have to schedule meetings. She grades you harder on the final draft than the rough draft. Overall you can pass this class with hard work

I took the hybrid four week session and it was a lot of info in a small amount of time but i managed an A. There are two tests and they are open book and open note, but that also means shes looking for more detailed answers than a none open book test. There's a project too which helps, and hw and In class assignments. Shes keeps it interesting.

This class was amazing. You raise a virtual child, make a bucket list, and have daily class discussion. Tests are sometimes needlessly hard and she can be ridiculously specific. She/TAs were amazing and were willing to work with all of us individually. Must buy text. Attendance isn't mandatory but should be treated like it is. Take her for Devel.!

I loved this class. Dr. Marsil is very funny and had great examples. She was very helpful and met with me outside of her office hours to go over my exam. We raised a virtual child which was very fun. Def. take her for Lifespan.
Dr. Marsil for Research Methods is awful. Avoid at all cost. Tests are extremely difficult and powerpoints are not helpful. Reading the book is necessary.

I took this course online and earned an A. I found Dr. Marsil to be very inspiring and enthusiastic about the subject matter. She pushed students and provided further discussion when students had questions. I believe I enjoyed the subject matter and class more because of her instruction. Only drawback: very slow to return graded material.

I enjoyed the content of this class. Grading was mostly fair. Dr. Marsil was extremely strict regarding grammar and proper APA use. But, don't rely on her APA examples b/c some are wrong. Then, she counted off when I modeled after her's. Grades took 3 weeks instead of the 1 week cited in the syllabus. Some of her e-mail replies were very slow!

Took online course over the summer. Great class. The professor was very clear about what she wanted in the online discussions, but the tests were not very easy given that you can use your book. I would take her again.

Marsil's Research Methods class is tedious. Her powerpoints are extremely long. You must attend all classes to pass. She does not give a study guide. When she is teaching Standard Deviation, chi squared and zscores you must pay attention, she sometimes forgets how to do the problems herself.

I learned alot in this class. It was harder than I expected, but I feel like I can write a good paper now. Dr. Marsil is somewhat flexible and is very helpful. She spent extra time wiht me to make sure i got it.

Dr. Marsil is a very nice lady, but she is one of the worst teachers I have ever had. She does not explain the material clearly and makes the class way harder than necessary. This class was torture and my classmates have been moping about getting C's and D's the whole semester. The tests take two hours to take, so get ready to work hard for a C+!
She is very unclear about what is expected. I took the online class, and all I can say is you need to stay on top on it if you want a good grade.

GREAT PROFESSOR! The class was very interesting, but it is not easy, but she is helpful and available to her students. She is great with responding to e-mails. If you work hard and ask her any questions you may have, you will do great. Enjoy, but be prepared to work.

Do NOT take a hyprid. It was way more difficult than it should have been. A few times the lecture we had in class was not the chapter that we would have at the end of the week. She knows her stuff, and is fun so take her if it is a regular twice meeting weekly class.

I took this online. Lots of writing and reading. You have to read the chapters to make an A on the exam. Theyre questions you wouldnt be able to find easily without having read it. You only have 60 minutes for 60 questions, so you dont have time to find them in the book. You have set time aside each week like a normal class to succeed.

She told the class that she was intentionally grading on a curve to make the class average be a C. Since this is required for the Psych major, that means that about half the class needed to repeat the class. Though I beat the curve, I changed my major because of her.

Took this as an online class over the summer and it was really good. It involved weekly reflection posts and responses to other posts, but it was not hard, just challenging sometimes - the way it's supposed to be. The tests could be rough, but not too bad if you read the book. She was very helpful & quick to respond to questions.

I took this class 2 years ago, and it is the only C I have ever received at Kennesaw. She was HORRIBLE at planning, boring, not helpful, and could not properly explain anything! I would sooner die than take her again. Worst experience ever at kennesaw! Took 2301 with Dr. T and got an A...

Took this class Summer 08 online. Overall, good experience. Very reading intensive as you have 1/2 the normal time to do all the work. Not very good about getting grades back in a timely manner,there always seems to be an excuse. I would reccommend her but be prepared to work!! Be sure the read the research papers for your essay questions

I was not looking forward to this req. course and took it online. It was great. There was a lot of work, but I learned so much. Not the typical boring class. Dr. Marsil was very helpful. I would advise my friends to take her.

I took Dr. Marsil for online PSYC during the summer and I must say I actually enjoyed learning all the different stuff. She's pretty quick to respond but it's a short course so everything seems packed tightly. I recommend her, she's a great teacher.

I took this class online, as well as several others. This was very well organized. There is a good bit of work, but that is the same as any online class. I like the flexibility of online. Dr. Marsil was always willing to help when I was confused about something and even gave me feedback on a rough draft of a paper. I would take her again.

I took the online version of this course. It was a bit insane. We had to do tons of reflections and replies to other's reflections, short paper, and online exams. It was an ok class, but I imagine that the real class is much better.

She rewrote the syllabus twice to accomodate her bad planning skills. She pushed back the last half of the semester and threw out big assignments. When "teaching", she used large disjointed thoughts and was unable to give examples. She didn't know the math needed for the class.Test questions were cryptic and grading was based on her interpretation.

Dr. Marsil is a great teacher. She gives plenty of examples and stories about the material to help you learn. She has in class assignments, so it's best to show up so you don't miss it. You will do well on the tests if you read the book. The final was optional and there's plenty of extra credit available.

This class was so interesting and fun. Some lecture and some discussion. Dr. M is good at getting people to participate and doesn't just talk at us. Exams are mostly multiple choice and not that hard if you go to class and read the book. She does offer extra credit. No long papers, but some written in class activites. I would take her again.
I love this class. We get to discuss and not just get lectured to. There is a lot of work, but if you keep up, it is not a problem. Not hard to earn a good grade if you pay attention. I learned alot.
Dr. Marsil is a very difficult teacher. She has class discussions and they get off track. Her tests are awful. She had 35 to 50% essay and the multiple choice is a killer. Glad the class is over.

Her way of teaching is through class discussions, you have to listen to make the grades but it doesn't take much effort to get a decent grade. Her midterms/finals were really easy but her quizzes require you to read the book. I love the class interaction and you get to know everyone in the class.
Good class; you must read and participate. Very interesting discussions. Only two exams, there needs to be more. Very flexible and helpful on papers.

Discussion-based (not lecture-based) class. For the essay exams, she told us to focus on the basic concepts discussed & NOT the minute details. We were unprepared for the extensive multiple choice she later added. Discussions never stayed on track and our schedule was useless. We had to cram 5 wks worth of work into the last 2 wks of the semester.
